Detailed Description

This singleton class is the highest level of the application.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

App::App ( const std::string &  configFilename,
const char *  compileTime = NULL 
)

The constructor for the App class.

App::init needs to be called to fully initialise the application.

Parameters:
configFilename top level configuration file, eg "bigworld.xml".
compileTime build time stamp to display, if required.
See also:
App::init

Destructor for the App class.

void App::activeConsole ( std::string  v  ) 

This method sets the active console by name.

std::string App::activeConsole (  )  const

This method gets the name of the active console.

void App::activeCursor ( InputCursor *  cursor  ) 

Sets the active cursor.

The active cursor will get all mouse, keyboard and axis events forwarded to it. Only one cursor can be active at a time. The deactivate method will be called on the current active cursor (the one being deactivated), if any. The activate method will be called on the new active cursor. if any.

Parameters:
cursor the new active cursor, or NULL to simply deactivate the current one.

InputCursorPtr App::activeCursor (  ) 

Returns the current active cursor.

bool App::handleAxisEvent ( const AxisEvent &  event  )  [virtual]

This method overrides the InputHandler method to joystick axis events.

Returns:
True if the event was handled, false otherwise.

Reimplemented from InputHandler.

bool App::handleIMEEvent ( const IMEEvent &  event  )  [virtual]

This method overrides the InputHandler method to handle IME related events.

IME events occur when the active Input Method Editor has changed state.

Parameters:
event The current IME event.
Returns:
True if the event was handled, false otherwise.

Reimplemented from InputHandler.

bool App::handleInputLangChangeEvent (  )  [virtual]

This method overrides the InputHandler method to handle the even raised when the user changes the current input language.

Returns:
True if the event was handled, false otherwise.

Reimplemented from InputHandler.
